titleStmt.title: The true conuert. Or An exposition vpon the vvhole parable of the prodigall. Luke. 15. 11.12. &c. Wherein is manifestly shewed; 1. Mans miserable estate by forsaking of God. 2. Mans happie estate by returning to God. Deliuered in sundry sermons, by Nehemiah Rogers, preacher of Gods Word, at St Margarets Fish-street. And now by him published, intending the farther benefit of so many as then heard it; and the profit of so many as shall please to read it.
titleStmt.author: Rogers, Nehemiah, 1593-1660.

titleStmt.title: The true conuert. Or An exposition vpon the vvhole parable of the prodigall. Luke. 15. 11.12. &c. Wherein is manifestly shewed; 1. Mans miserable estate by forsaking of God. 2. Mans happie estate by returning to God. Deliuered in sundry sermons, by Nehemiah Rogers, preacher of Gods Word, at St Margarets Fish-street. And now by him published, intending the farther benefit of so many as then heard it; and the profit of so many as shall please to read it.
titleStmt.author: Rogers, Nehemiah, 1593-1660.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edward Griffin for Edward Brewster, and are to be sold at his shop, at the west gate of Pauls, at the signe of the Starre,

notesStmt.note: The words "1. Mans miserable estate .. returning to God." are bracketed together on the title page.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
